Pre-Game Insights: India and Australia are both starting their World Cup campaigns as home favourites.
India haven't seen a full house at this World Cup yet, making this match at Chepauk significant.
Chepauk is known for its good cricket atmosphere, regardless of the team playing.
India are better equipped in terms of spinners but have faced Australia at Chepauk before and lost.
The pitch is expected to be straw-coloured and black-soil, inducing India to play three spinners.
The weather is expected to be muggy with a forecast maximum of 33 degrees Celsius.
Shubman Gill is recovering from dengue and is a doubtful starter.
Marcus Stoinis is in a race against time due to a hamstring injury, with Cameron Green likely to take his place.
India captain Rohit Sharma emphasized the importance of the World Cup and the need for balance.
Australia captain Pat Cummins highlighted the journey aspect of the World Cup and his enjoyment of leading the team.
